div.p: Honorable, highly learned, especially gracious, dear sir, I send you my friendly greetings along with my willingness to serve at any time, etc. I express my great thanks for your friendly sympathy and offer of willing service, with the assurance that I am always ready to show you love and service.

Regarding what I have arranged in Basel on behalf of my lords' recent writings, you will be well informed by my lord mayor, along with the latest news from France, which I have sent to the aforementioned lord. I had intended to depart from Basel this coming Saturday; however, the gout has so severely affected my hands that such a departure is not possible for me. Nevertheless, I am hopeful, if nothing else intervenes, to set out shortly after Christmas, as the time and delay are very tedious and vexing for me, etc. With this, I commend you to the Almighty's long-lasting protection, etc.
Your willing friend and supporter, etc. Johann Haab, mayor.
To the honorable, highly learned Master Heinrich Bullinger, chief pastor of the city of Zürich, my especially gracious lord and friend. Zürich.
